title: Congratulations Riot, Your P0S Leaver system works.
body:
Congratulations for giving me a Leaver Buster bull shit "type I agree" thing.

I was enjoying an awesome game of ARAM, and then I received a wonderful notification that the riot client was attempting to reconnect me.   Suprise, Suprise, it never did.  Now I will refrain from playing another match until the client is safe to use again, because of the inexorable amount of money I have spent on this game, and the fact I've never left a game apart from a family emergency back before Season 1.

Now I get slapped with a Leaver tag, which is completely your fault for having a crappy client that doesn't know up from down.  

Will wait to play again until the client has been fixed, even if I must wait a year or more.  Thanks. -.-

So Congratulations, your system is working as intended, and driving legitimate players from the game.

#InsultedGamer

Edit: I'd also like to note, it was a premade match with a bunch of friends that I was talking with on Teamspeak at the time.

replies.body: Yeah, that happened to me too. And I got that whole guilting message asking me to pledge I wouldn't leave a game again. Like I can understand the system, but they need to find a way to make sure it differentiates between leavers and disconnects.
yeah I feel tainted now...

As I see it really differentiates the two. Unless you have such a bad internet that it makes the game unplayable for you I don't think it gets you banned. The old system flagged you just like this one, just it didn't tell you. The only change this system brings is if you play ranked when you might leave or DC then you might have a bad time.

As far as I understand it didn't flag you for as much silly things as the current one does. If it did I would be annoyed by that too. Also being forced to sign something is shitty especially when you finish a game or have bad lag or whatever. I also think a low priority queue is just a stupid idea in general. It deincentivies people from playing even people who riot wants in their community. At least with the old system you got a warning before you got banned and then banned for a period of time and not able to queue for a long time

We would need Lyte to confirm the flagging conditions. I too don't like the wording of the warning and the fact that most leavers aren't intentional makes it generally a bad experience, but it was a good intention to punish ranked leavers harder.
dont hold your breath, been a month since the client doesnt work right, just keep posting about it and upvoting those that do as well

Just to clarify a few points, the first time you leave on an account you will get the "I Agree" notification.

This is a **one-time thing per account**, and happens regardless of it being a low level game, high level game, a DC or intentional leave. However, this one-time notification has nothing to do with a punishment or the status of your account. It's literally just a notification that leaving/AFKing in League is bad.

If you chronically leave/AFK in games following the notification, it is possible to receive penalties. The notification is just for us to ensure that players know the potential penalties before they chronically leave dozens of matches. After the one-time notification, we do tune the system so that most players who have the rare DC or emergency won't ever see a penalty--only players who leave strings of matches in a frequent pattern will see low priority queue.

Then you guys need to seriously reword that prompt because the way it is currently written I took it as a literal "you're fucked fuck you" piece of literature -- no offense.

Edit:  That or have the prompt pop up right as soon as people log in.  Then it's less of a slap to the face.

Didn't we use to get emails about that? I remember back like 2 years ago, when I started playing, I would leave games because i was new to it and I came from playing Call of Duty. I thought leaving games was just a normal thing and that matchmaking found a new payer to replace you(lool was i wrong), and then I got an email telling me all these reasons to why its bad...  I never left a game since then...Until three days ago when the client decided it didn't want to work and I get this notification making me agree to never leave a game like if i have control over the client working or not.

The primary difference between those emails and this notification is in placement.

The email you received was an indicator that you had been detected leaving multiple times, and were actually close to a ban. It was a Warning - the lowest level of punishment available to the system.

This notification occurs the *first* time the new system detects you as leaving. It doesn't have that same implication of being close to a ban, and it's not considered any form of punishment in and of itself.

Honestly, I like the idea of this kind of message showing up this rapidly, but damn if it doesn't need to be rewritten.

Slightly off-topic, but exactly how far down the line is the "I Agree" notification? I've heard you talking enough to know it doesn't mean I'm in trouble yet, but it is a little unclear and it's making people gun-shy. The fact that there are so many posts like this one supports that, I think.
1st leave/dc you have, you get the message and have to type I agree I think.

You get this popup as soon as you log in after a leave. It's meant to shove this part of the terms of use in your face, so if you are new to the game and didn't know this you wouldn't leave again. The problem is it's quite badly worded and some people get punished for connection issues too.

The internet was out for half the day and part of the night on one, the second one was less sever, just 3 hours, which is a significant improvement upon the stuff before. I didn't get a message with the "I agree" until after the second time when i logged in. So, either Riot F-ed up and the leaver buster program doesn't work like it should or it's after two times of leaving games.
it might have been a bug, I got the message for the first leave and Lyte says in his comment this too.

Why isn't there a single response to this issue? I mean the fact that recently there is a bug that doesn't allow us to connect, blames our firewalls, (which let's be real: if you're kicked from a ranked game and it blames your firewall, you probably go and disable it, assuming it was even on in the first place) and then shames us for doing nothing wrong. I understand holiday time, being busy, but this is a bug that is punishing players for something they have no control over.
Yeah, this is a great system. I enjoy getting punished for Riot's client bugging out.

Also this just makes game fun its already annoying having to wait an hour to get into a game needing to dodge due to people who clearly are going to load in and ruin game, yet I leave when I am fed up having to dodge these players and not get to play then get low priority so now i get to wait 30 minutes to start, 5 minutes to load queue, then another 3-5 minutes just to get into lobby.

All it does it piss people off and leave the real trouble makers scott free

Uhhh well... voluntarily or not, you left a match in progress which negatively impacted your team. Also I don't see how your ISP crashing is Riot's fault.

There is absolutely no way for Riot to tell if you are pulling your connection intentionally or unintentionally. Would you prefer to have more of your games ruined by people unplugging their modems and not getting punished for it?

I highly doubt you're ever going to get banned because your ISP crashed once in half a year's time.

You can't have Riot punish leavers but not punish you for leaving... that's ludicrous.

Do people actually pull their connection though?   Maybe I'm just incredibly naive, but why would someone go to the effort of unplugging their router just to leave a match?   If people have to stoop to those levels than I feel sorry for their subconscious dissatisfaction with themselves.

If literally all it took to leave a match with no penalty is flipping the wifi-disable switch on your laptop (functionally equivalent to unplugging your router), you better believe your games would be full of leavers.

When you queue up, you have committed yourself to something for 30-60 minutes.  Of course there are more important things than LoL, but that doesn't change the fact that if you leave a game, you are ruining the fun of at least 4 other people [and at most 9 others] and there are consequences for your actions and choices.

Don't queue up if you have to be somewhere before the game is over, or take the punishment like an adult.  The responsibility is on you to manage your life.

> Be aware that other players can be under 13 year old(my lol friend) and may have restrictions. 

You have to be 13 years or older to do anything online, at least in the US.  Otherwise, don't play if you cannot manage your time properly.  Talk to your parents about what LoL is, and how you can't just abandon the other people in a match.  Hell, I'm 27 and I still ask my parents if they need me to do anything for the next hour or so before I play a LoL game when visiting them.

> Also be aware that other players may have recent or current emergencies. Oh, I get it, get all the players that won't play lol as a video game to leave so YOU can be one of the future Olympic games?

It sucks, but sometimes you have emergencies.  Generally, they are few and far between. If you have them enough to get banned, you maybe need to sort your life out a bit and not play LoL so much.

It is promoting the belief that LoL should be of equal importance to other parts of your life. No matter HOW you try to spin it, the concept that LoL should have an equal weight to other aspects by being treated as a MUST FINISH if you start activity... is an unhealthy level of addiction.

LeaverBuster is good for a game that **is stable**. I am sorry to tell you this but RIOT League of Legends is far from **stable.**

We are talking about a game :
- Disconnect the players during game play randomly.
- Close randomly with a nice BugSplat
- Attempts to connect to the game, enter the black screen and asking us to try again
- Monstrous lags
- Disconnects from PVP.Net .

So before talking about someone who disconnects their internet and create a wild system connection , it should ensure that your service is completely bulletproof.

So RIOT, would not it be better to rely on the tribunal as long as you have not done to fix your server.
